meanings.definition: Of or relating to the retina.
meanings.sent1: The retinular cells in the eye help us see light and color.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the retinular tissue to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The retinular layer of the eye was so sensitive, it could detect even the faintest glimmer.
meanings.sent4: Her retinular vision was so sharp, she could spot a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: The retinular function of the eye is crucial for clear vision.

meanings.sent1: The retinular sends signals to the brain to process visual information.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the retinular under a microscope to understand its structure.
meanings.sent3: The retinular in the eye had a party and invited all the other cells.
meanings.sent4: The retinular acted like a conductor, coordinating the visual symphony.
meanings.sent5: Each retinular played a unique role in forming the complete visual picture.
